MemberSignature.Value: public static void AddPeriodicSync (Android.Accounts.Account account, string authority, Android.OS.Bundle extras, long pollFrequency);
.method public static hidebysig void AddPeriodicSync(class Android.Accounts.Account account, string authority, class Android.OS.Bundle extras, int64 pollFrequency) cil managed
static member AddPeriodicSync : Android.Accounts.Account * string * Android.OS.Bundle * int64 -> unit

Docs.param: the account to specify in the sync
the provider to specify in the sync request
extra parameters to go along with the sync request
how frequently the sync should be performed, in seconds. On Android API level 24 and above, a minmam interval of 15 minutes is enforced. On previous versions, the minimum interval is 1 hour.
Docs.summary: Specifies that a sync should be requested with the specified the account, authority, and extras at the given frequency.

Docs.exception: if an illegal extra was set or if any of the parameters are null.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Android.Net.Uri Canonicalize(class Android.Net.Uri url) cil managed

Docs.param: The Uri that is to be transformed to a canonical representation. Like all resolver calls, the input can be either a non-canonical or canonical Uri.
Docs.summary: Transform the given <var>url</var> to a canonical representation of its referenced resource, which can be used across devices, persisted, backed up and restored, etc.
Docs.returns: Returns the official canonical representation of <var>url</var>, or null if the content provider does not support a canonical representation of the given Uri. Many providers may not support canonicalization of some or all of their Uris.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

abstract member GetStreamTypes : Android.Net.Uri * string -> string[] override this.GetStreamTypes : Android.Net.Uri * string -> string[]

Docs.param: A Uri identifying content (either a list or specific type), using the content:// scheme.
The desired MIME type. This may be a pattern, such as */*, to query for all available MIME types that match the pattern.
Docs.summary: Query for the possible MIME types for the representations the given content URL can be returned when opened as as stream with #openTypedAssetFileDescriptor.
Docs.returns: Returns an array of MIME type strings for all available data streams that match the given mimeTypeFilter. If there are none, null is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void NotifyChange (Android.Net.Uri uri, Android.Database.ContentObserver observer);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void NotifyChange(class Android.Net.Uri uri, class Android.Database.ContentObserver observer) cil managed
abstract member NotifyChange : Android.Net.Uri * Android.Database.ContentObserver -> unit override this.NotifyChange : Android.Net.Uri * Android.Database.ContentObserver -> unit

Docs.param: The uri of the content that was changed.

The observer that originated the change, may be <code>null</null>. The observer that originated the change will only receive the notification if it has requested to receive self-change notifications by implementing ContentObserver#deliverSelfNotifications() to return true.
Docs.summary: Notify registered observers that a row was updated and attempt to sync changes to the network.

The string representation of the file mode. Can be "r", "w", "wt", "wa", "rw" or "rwt". SeeParcelFileDescriptor#parseMode for more details.
Docs.summary: Open a raw file descriptor to access data under a URI.
Docs.returns: Returns a new ParcelFileDescriptor pointing to the file or null if the provider recently crashed. You own this descriptor and are responsible for closing it when done.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: Throws FileNotFoundException of no file exists under the URI or the mode is invalid.

MemberSignature.Value: public Android.Content.Res.AssetFileDescriptor OpenTypedAssetFileDescriptor (Android.Net.Uri uri, string mimeType, Android.OS.Bundle opts);
.method public hidebysig instance class Android.Content.Res.AssetFileDescriptor OpenTypedAssetFileDescriptor(class Android.Net.Uri uri, string mimeType, class Android.OS.Bundle opts) cil managed
member this.OpenTypedAssetFileDescriptor : Android.Net.Uri * string * Android.OS.Bundle -> Android.Content.Res.AssetFileDescriptor

Docs.param: The desired URI to open.

The desired MIME type of the returned data. This can be a pattern such as */*, which will allow the content provider to select a type, though there is no way for you to determine what type it is returning.
Additional provider-dependent options.
Docs.summary: Open a raw file descriptor to access (potentially type transformed) data from a "content:" URI.
Docs.returns: Returns a new ParcelFileDescriptor from which you can read the data stream from the provider or null if the provider recently crashed. Note that this may be a pipe, meaning you can't seek in it. The only seek you should do is if the AssetFileDescriptor contains an offset, to move to that offset before reading. You own this descriptor and are responsible for closing it when done.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: Throws FileNotFoundException of no data of the desired type exists under the URI.

Docs.param: The desired URI to open.

The desired MIME type of the returned data. This can be a pattern such as */*, which will allow the content provider to select a type, though there is no way for you to determine what type it is returning.
Additional provider-dependent options.
A signal to cancel the operation in progress, or null if none. If the operation is canceled, then will be thrown.
Docs.summary: Open a raw file descriptor to access (potentially type transformed) data from a "content:" URI.
Docs.returns: Returns a new ParcelFileDescriptor from which you can read the data stream from the provider or null if the provider recently crashed. Note that this may be a pipe, meaning you can't seek in it. The only seek you should do is if the AssetFileDescriptor contains an offset, to move to that offset before reading. You own this descriptor and are responsible for closing it when done.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: Throws FileNotFoundException of no data of the desired type exists under the URI.

MemberSignature.Value: public Android.Database.ICursor Query (Android.Net.Uri uri, string[] projection, Android.OS.Bundle queryArgs, Android.OS.CancellationSignal cancellationSignal);

.method public hidebysig instance class Android.Database.ICursor Query(class Android.Net.Uri uri, string[] projection, class Android.OS.Bundle queryArgs, class Android.OS.CancellationSignal cancellationSignal) cil managed
member this.Query : Android.Net.Uri * string[] * Android.OS.Bundle * Android.OS.CancellationSignal -> Android.Database.ICursor

Docs.param: The URI, using the content:// scheme, for the content to retrieve.
A list of which columns to return. Passing null will return all columns, which is inefficient.

A Bundle containing additional information necessary for the operation. Arguments may include SQL style arguments, such as ContentResolver#QUERY_ARG_SQL_LIMIT, but note that the documentation for each individual provider will indicate which arguments they support.
A signal to cancel the operation in progress, or null if none. If the operation is canceled, then OperationCanceledException will be thrown when the query is executed.
Docs.summary: Query the given URI, returning a Cursor over the result set with support for cancellation.
Docs.returns: A Cursor object, which is positioned before the first entry. May return null if the underlying content provider returns null, or if it crashes.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public Android.Database.ICursor Query (Android.Net.Uri uri, string[] projection, string selection, string[] selectionArgs, string sortOrder);
.method public hidebysig instance class Android.Database.ICursor Query(class Android.Net.Uri uri, string[] projection, string selection, string[] selectionArgs, string sortOrder) cil managed
member this.Query : Android.Net.Uri * string[] * string * string[] * string -> Android.Database.ICursor

Docs.param: The URI, using the content:// scheme, for the content to retrieve.
A list of which columns to return. Passing null will return all columns, which is inefficient.
A filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows for the given URI.
You may include ?s in selection, which will be replaced by the values from selectionArgs, in the order that they appear in the selection. The values will be bound as Strings.
How to order the rows, formatted as an SQL ORDER BY clause (excluding the ORDER BY itself). Passing null will use the default sort order, which may be unordered.
Docs.summary: Query the given URI, returning a Cursor over the result set with support for cancellation.
Docs.returns: A Cursor object, which is positioned before the first entry. May return null if the underlying content provider returns null, or if it crashes.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public Android.Database.ICursor Query (Android.Net.Uri uri, string[] projection, string selection, string[] selectionArgs, string sortOrder, Android.OS.CancellationSignal cancellationSignal);

.method public hidebysig instance class Android.Database.ICursor Query(class Android.Net.Uri uri, string[] projection, string selection, string[] selectionArgs, string sortOrder, class Android.OS.CancellationSignal cancellationSignal) cil managed
member this.Query : Android.Net.Uri * string[] * string * string[] * string * Android.OS.CancellationSignal -> Android.Database.ICursor
MemberSignature.Usage: contentResolver.Query (uri, projection, selection, selectionArgs, sortOrder, cancellationSignal)

Docs.param: The URI, using the content:// scheme, for the content to retrieve.
A list of which columns to return. Passing null will return all columns, which is inefficient.
A filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows for the given URI.
You may include ?s in selection, which will be replaced by the values from selectionArgs, in the order that they appear in the selection. The values will be bound as Strings.
How to order the rows, formatted as an SQL ORDER BY clause (excluding the ORDER BY itself). Passing null will use the default sort order, which may be unordered.
A signal to cancel the operation in progress, or null if none. If the operation is canceled, then OperationCanceledException will be thrown when the query is executed.
Docs.summary: Query the given URI, returning a Cursor over the result set with support for cancellation.
Docs.returns: A Cursor object, which is positioned before the first entry. May return null if the underlying content provider returns null, or if it crashes.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Specifies the list of columns (stored as a String[]) against which to group results.
Specifies the max number of rows to include in a Cursor.

Docs.summary: Allows client to specify a hint to the provider declaring which locale to use when sorting values.
Key for an SQL style GROUP BY string that may be present in the query Bundle argument passed to ContentProvider#query(Uri, String[], Bundle, CancellationSignal).
Key for an SQL style HAVING string that may be present in the query Bundle argument passed to ContentProvider#query(Uri, String[], Bundle, CancellationSignal).
Key for an SQL style LIMIT string that may be present in the query Bundle argument passed to ContentProvider#query(Uri, String[], Bundle, CancellationSignal).

MemberSignature.Value: public bool Refresh (Android.Net.Uri url, Android.OS.Bundle extras, Android.OS.CancellationSignal cancellationSignal);
.method public hidebysig instance bool Refresh(class Android.Net.Uri url, class Android.OS.Bundle extras, class Android.OS.CancellationSignal cancellationSignal) cil managed
member this.Refresh : Android.Net.Uri * Android.OS.Bundle * Android.OS.CancellationSignal -> bool

Docs.param: The Uri identifying the data to refresh.
Additional options from the client. The definitions of these are specific to the content provider being called.

A signal to cancel the operation in progress, or null if none. For example, if you called refresh on a particular uri, you should call CancellationSignal#throwIfCanceled() to check whether the client has canceled the refresh request.
Docs.summary: This allows clients to request an explicit refresh of content identified by uri.
Docs.returns: true if the provider actually tried refreshing.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public void RegisterContentObserver (Android.Net.Uri uri, bool notifyForDescendants, Android.Database.ContentObserver observer);
.method public hidebysig instance void RegisterContentObserver(class Android.Net.Uri uri, bool notifyForDescendants, class Android.Database.ContentObserver observer) cil managed
member this.RegisterContentObserver : Android.Net.Uri * bool * Android.Database.ContentObserver -> unit

Docs.param: The URI to watch for changes. This can be a specific row URI, or a base URI for a whole class of content.

When false, the observer will be notified whenever a change occurs to the exact URI specified by uri or to one of the URI's ancestors in the path hierarchy. When true, the observer will also be notified whenever a change occurs to the URI's descendants in the path hierarchy.
The object that receives callbacks when changes occur.
Docs.summary: Register an observer class that gets callbacks when data identified by a given content URI changes.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Android.Net.Uri Uncanonicalize(class Android.Net.Uri url) cil managed

Docs.param: The canonical Uri that is to be convered back to its non-canonical form.
Docs.summary: Given a canonical Uri previously generated by #canonicalize, convert it to its local non-canonical form.
Docs.returns: Returns the non-canonical representation of <var>url</var>. This will return null if data identified by the canonical Uri can not be found in the current environment; callers must always check for null and deal with that by appropriately falling back to an alternative.

MemberSignature.Value: public int Update (Android.Net.Uri uri, Android.Content.ContentValues values, Android.OS.Bundle extras);
.method public hidebysig instance int32 Update(class Android.Net.Uri uri, class Android.Content.ContentValues values, class Android.OS.Bundle extras) cil managed

Docs.param: The URI to modify.
The new field values. The key is the column name for the field. A null value will remove an existing field value.

A Bundle containing additional information necessary for the operation. Arguments may include SQL style arguments, such as ContentResolver#QUERY_ARG_SQL_LIMIT, but note that the documentation for each individual provider will indicate which arguments they support.
Docs.summary: Update row(s) in a content URI.
Docs.returns: the number of rows updated.

MemberSignature.Value: public int Update (Android.Net.Uri uri, Android.Content.ContentValues values, string where, string[] selectionArgs);

member this.Update : Android.Net.Uri * Android.Content.ContentValues * string * string[] -> int

Docs.param: The URI to modify.
The new field values. The key is the column name for the field. A null value will remove an existing field value.
A filter to apply to rows before updating, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself).
To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig void ValidateSyncExtrasBundle(class Android.OS.Bundle extras) cil managed

Docs.param: the Bundle to check
Docs.summary:
Check that only values of the following types are in the Bundle:
  • Integer
  • Long
  • Boolean
  • Float
  • Double
  • String
  • Account
  • null
